content: Seems NASA has had bats hanging onto the space shuttle through the launch sequence. "http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/shuttle/shuttlemissions/sts119/launchbat.html" During the shuttles clearing of the launch tower the bat was seen changing positions and hung on. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

title: NASA and the bats

content: I wanted to be a SPACE BAT, that's what I wanted to be. I would imagine that once he got high enough he probably dropped into the blast of the main engines. (crispy critter) Or as some birds do he locked on and rode the thing all the way. Some birds can lock their claws into a tree and die that way. Rigor sets in and they don't drop until they lose the rigor and drop or flatten out on the branch. Does the main tank drop into the ocean or does it parachute back and get recovered? Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

title: NASA and the bats

content: Bat out of Hell! It was probably crushed by the G-forces within the first 30-seconds, if it managed to hang on that long! As to Birds setting their talons; I've actually found pairs of them stuck on boughs and the bird itself has long since disappeared, or what's left of it's dessicated carcass is laying beneath on the ground! The first time you see it, it's kind of bizzare, but then you start watching for them if you spend enough time in the woods! It is not our belief or disbelief that can make or unmake the fact. ~ Thomas Paine

title: NASA and the bats

content: I've told this here before, but here it is anyway. I was walking down a narrow road which ran next to a grove of Douglas firs. I noticed out of the corner of my eye something dropping down to the ground and heard it thump. I walked down to the object and it turned out to be an old, really old Crow that had died in the night and then the next morning when the other crows were apparently nudging it and knocked it off the branch it had passed on. After I walked back up to the road all of the crows started cackling and crowing like crazy. They went on like that for about two minutes and then just stopped as quick as they started and flew off. Yeah it was real weird and I did think about the movie "The BIRDS" and wanted to get out of there quick but logic reined me in and I went on about my business. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
